intro: Tricercandra japonica, commonly known as the Japanese tricercandra, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Tricercandra japonica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
